verb.description: Diminish the worth or value of (a quality or achievement)
examples: these quibbles in no way detract from her achievement

verb.description: Cause someone or something to be distracted or diverted from.
examples: the complaint was timed to detract attention from the ethics issue
the role did not include operational responsibilities that would detract him from his work

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin detract- drawn away, from the verb detrahere, from de- away from + trahere draw.
